data.title: Amgen Biotech Experience
data.text:
How to Get Involved

Learn how you can be part of this exciting program and support STEM education in your community.

Educators

ABE provides curriculum materials, loans kits of research-grade biotechnology equipment and supplies, and offers professional development. ABE teachers are part of a global community, with opportunities for virtual or in-person classroom visits and/or mentorship from Amgen staff, or to be selected for an ABE Master Teacher Fellowship. Find out if there is an ABE program site near you to see if there are spots available!! If you are not in a location where ABE is active, you can still access our curriculum materials and resources, and attend professional development at your own expense (to do so, contact the nearest ABE program site.)

Find a Site

Find Curriculum & Resources

STEM Professionals

Interested in being a role model and inspiring the next generation of STEM professionals and innovators? Virtual and in-person opportunities are available to Amgen staff at all levels in the company to share your career journeys with students in schools participating in the ABE Volunteer Program (AVP). If a classroom visit doesn’t interest you, you may also become a reviewer of new ABE content, advise our Master Teacher Fellows in their fellowship projects, or share your career journey via a written or video profile.

Volunteer

Corporations & Foundations

The contributions of the organizations that are program supporters are essential to our ability to reach as many teachers and students as we do each year. In addition to providing equipment and materials for no or reduced cost, program supporters also provide funding to run affiliate ABE program sites, making ABE available to schools located far from Amgen locations. If you’d like to support the ABE program, please contact the ABE Program Office or click below for more information.

Support ABE

Questions about how to get involved? Email ABEInfo@edc.org.

Stay Informed

Read our posts

Subscribe

Follow us

Participating Schools

In a typical year, 900 schools and 1,500 teachers participate in ABE, serving 90,000 students.

Since 2002, ABE has been implemented at 2,000+ schools, working with ~4,400 teachers and reaching 990,000+ students.

ABE Program Sites

Asia Pacific

ABE Australia

ABE Australia is supported by The University of Sydney, and empowers teachers across Greater Sydney to deliver biotechnology labs closely aligned to the high school curriculum. A core focus is supporting and promoting STEM education in underresourced or geographically isolated communities.

ABE Australia Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Hong Kong SAR

ABE Hong Kong is supported by the Chinese University of Hong Kong and is tailored to enrich the Diploma of Secondary Education (DSE) biology curriculum.

ABE Hong Kong SAR Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Japan

ABE Japan is hosted and supported by Graduate School of Agricultural and Life Sciences (GSALS), The University of Tokyo. The University of Tokyo was established in 1877 as the first national university in Japan. As a leading research university, UTokyo offers courses in essentially all academic disciplines at both undergraduate and graduate levels and conducts research across the full spectrum of academic activity.

ABE Japan Fact Sheet (English) | ABE Japan Fact Sheet (Japanese) | Contact | View Location

ABE Mainland China

ABE Mainland China is supported by the Center for Life Sciences and Center for Laboratory Training in Life Sciences, Tsinghua University. The university will leverage the cutting-edge discoveries of our prestigious scientists and engage teachers from across mainland China in the program.

ABE Mainland China Fact Sheet | ABE Mainland China Fact Sheet (Chinese Simplified) | Contact | View Location

ABE Singapore

ABE Singapore is supported by Science Centre Singapore and provides teacher professional development, student workshops and educational resources to schools in Singapore.

ABE Singapore Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

Europe, Türkiye, & Africa

ABE France

ABE France is supported by the Department of Biology at L'Ecole Normale Supérieure.

ABE France Fact Sheet (English) | ABE France Fact Sheet (French) | Contact | View Location

ABE Germany

ABE Germany is supported by the Technical University of Munich (TUM) and the Schülerforschungszentrum Berchtesgadener Land. Led by the faculty of TUM School of Education, ABE benefits from unique and innovative research-based learning and teaching concepts. Thus encouraging teachers and students to inspire and empower the STEM scientists of tomorrow.

ABE Germany Fact Sheet (English) | ABE Germany Fact Sheet (German) | ABE@TUM Website | Contact | View Location

ABE Ireland

ABE Ireland is supported by the University College Dublin and has provided laboratory training, equipment, and educational materials tailored to the curriculum to teachers from over 100 schools since its inception.

ABE Ireland Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Italy

ABE Italy is supported by the National Association of Natural Science Teachers (ANISN), which collaborates with the University of Naples "Federico II" and the Institute of Biosciences and BioResources of the National Council of Research.

ABE Italy Fact Sheet (English) | ABE Italy Fact Sheet (Italian) | Contact | View Location

ABE South Africa

ABE South Africa is supported by and hosted at Sci-Bono Discovery Centre located in Johannesburg. Sci-Bono is the largest science center in Southern Africa with a mission to assist people in South Africa with instilling a culture of science and technology by providing a unique platform to explore and better understand the world of science. ABE South Africa serves teachers and learners in the Gauteng province, targeting schools mostly from marginalized areas.

ABE South Africa Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE The Netherlands

ABE The Netherlands is supported by DNA-labs on the Road, a unique STEM project in which six universities and university medical centers collaborate to bring advanced DNA technologies into the classroom.

ABE The Netherlands Fact Sheet (English) | ABE Nederland Fact Sheet (Dutch) | Contact | View Location

ABE Türkiye

ABE Türkiye is supported by the Development Workshop, which collaborates with universities (e.g., Middle East Technical University), associations, NGOs, schools, and companies to empower teachers to bring this innovative biotechnology curriculum to their classrooms and disseminate it across the country.

ABE Türkiye Fact Sheet (English) | ABE Türkiye Fact Sheet (Turkish) | Contact | View Location

ABE United Kingdom

ABE United Kingdom is supported by the University of Hertfordshire Centre for STEM Education and is proud of the contribution it has made to its wider aims of inspiring young people in STEM through high-quality professional learning for educators.

ABE United Kingdom Fact Sheet | View Location

The Americas

ABE Brazil

ABE Brazil is hosted and supported by the Center for Biological and Health Sciences at Mackenzie Presbyterian University, working in partnership with Sincroniza Educação to bring ABE to schools in the West Region of São Paulo to complement the Brazilian new high school curriculum.

ABE Brazil Fact Sheet | ABE Brazil Fact Sheet (Portuguese) | Contact | View Location

ABE Canada

ABE Canada is supported by The University of Toronto Mississauga (UTM), and collaborates with local scientists, NPOs, industry experts, and Amgen Canada to inspire the next generation of STEM scientists in the Greater Toronto Area.

ABE@UTM Webpage | ABE Canada Fact Sheet (English) | ABE Canada Fact Sheet (French) | Contact | View Location

ABE Central Ohio

ABE Central Ohio is supported by and hosted at Columbus State Community College. CSCC faculty, from both career and technical education and biological sciences, will partner with local K–12 institutions, Columbus Promise, the Central Ohio Compact, and College Credit Plus, to offer professional development and support to secondary school teachers to help them bring ABE to their classrooms and to raise students' career awareness of opportunities in the biotech industry.

ABE Central Ohio Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Greater Los Angeles Area

ABE Greater Los Angeles Area is supported by LA Promise fund and partnerships with local colleges, industry leaders, and educators that together aim to educate and inspire the next generation of STEM scientists. A major focus of ABE Greater Los Angeles Area is to increase diversity in STEM by serving underrepresented communities.

ABE Greater LA Area Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Kentucky

ABE Kentucky is supported by Bellarmine University in Louisville, Kentucky.

ABE Kentucky Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Massachusetts

ABE Massachusetts, housed at Northeastern University’s Biopharmaceutical Analysis and Training Laboratory (BATL), strives to empower teachers and students in Massachusetts to explore and unlock all the opportunities biotechnology has to offer. ABE Massachusetts hopes to provide these opportunities to students throughout the state and, in particular, to underrepresented populations.

ABE Massachusetts Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Mexico

In Mexico, the ABE Program is developed in middle schools that serve low-income students. These schools are located in Mexico City and the state of Morelos. The Universidad Autónoma Metropolitana- Iztapalapa, one of the most recognized public universities in Mexico City, is the partner university. Natalia Mayen and Viridiana Martínez are the leaders of the program, who from Fundación EDUCA coordinate the implementation in Mexico.

ABE Mexico Fact Sheet | ABE Mexico Fact Sheet (Spanish) | Contact | View Location

ABE North Carolina

ABE North Carolina is supported by North Carolina A&T State University (NCATSU) and serves schools in central North Carolina. ABE NC focuses on school districts (and within them schools) that have differential enrollment of underrepresented minority students.

ABE North Carolina Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Puerto Rico

The University of Puerto Rico at Humacao (UPRH) is the main undergraduate institution of the University of Puerto Rico System in the eastern region of Puerto Rico. Since 2008, the ABE Puerto Rico program has successfully empowered teachers to include hands-on laboratory experiences and exposed students to the cutting-edge field of biotech.

ABE Puerto Rico Fact Sheet (English) | ABE Puerto Rico Fact Sheet (Spanish) | Contact | View Location

ABE Rhode Island

ABE Rhode Island is led by the University of Rhode Island (URI). The ABE Rhode Island program acts as an extension of URI's science education reform effort into the state's high and middle schools.

ABE Rhode Island Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE San Diego

ABE San Diego is supported by Biocom California Institute, which has served as an intermediary between the life sciences industry and the education system in San Diego for over a decade, and by San Diego Miramar College, a leader in K–12 biotechnology education in Southern California.

ABE San Diego Area Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE San Francisco Bay Area

ABE San Francisco Bay Area is supported by the Lawrence Hall of Science, University of California, Berkeley. They collaborate with a range of local partners including community organizations as well as commercial and nonprofit scientific entities to inspire all students to engage with and explore STEM in the world around them.

ABE San Francisco Bay Area Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Tampa

ABE Tampa is supported by the Department of Integrative Biology at the University of South Florida (USF IB) in partnership with Hillsborough County Public Schools and the Tampa Bay STEM Network.

ABE Tampa Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location

ABE Washington State

ABE Washington State, an ABE affiliate, is supported by Shoreline Community College and is funded by various grants as well as by a generous contribution from EmbiTec. Our aim is to inspire young people in STEM through preparing and equipping teachers to teach STEM.

ABE Washington State Fact Sheet | Contact | View Location
